Content: affix added to nouns forming words which refer to a specific one of several:
That fish there, not that one further over.
added to possessive pronouns: the particular one that belongs to [so-and-so].
Dakù ang amúang balay, gamay tung iláha,
Our house is large, and theirs is small.
affix added to adjectives to form exclamation.
I’ll kill you, you dog you!
particle used as a pause word before starting to speak.
Um, are you going to come here tomorrow?
deprecating or showing unimportance of what just preceded.
Oh, it’s all the same to me.
Oh, yes. There were two of them, weren’t there.
Oh, so your name is Lito.
particle preceding or following a sentence with an adjective predicate.
dismissing s.t. as impractical, too easy, impossible, etc.
à, mu ra diay nà? Kasayun à!
Oh, is that all there is to it? How easy it is!
à, ása man ku mutúu nímu,
Hm, you think I could believe you?
How come you have such a beautiful dress on!
ábà tuy, maáyu ka lang sa tayáda, wà kay tadtad,
Shut up! You’re great at talking, but let’s see you do s.t.
act, treat like, consider a hillbilly.
You just think I’m a hillbilly. Don’t try to fool me.
be the boss and not henpecked.
Ab-ábun sa irù ang íyang hikut,
The dog will chew up his rope.
Ang pagluib ni Maríya nag-ab-ab sa íyang balatían,
Maria’s infidelity ate away at his insides.
Giab-ab ang íyang pinútì sa tayà,
His sword was eaten away by rust.
give material help, help do work.
Kinsa may mag-ábag nímu sa ímung pag-iskuyla?
Who will help pay for your schooling?
sweet potatoes growing from the outer vines and not from the main root.
Abagáhun (pangabagáhun, pangabagáhan) ni Mánuy níya ang galastúhan sa pag-iskuyla,
His brother will shoulder his school expenses.
We must undertake to carry out this program.
bound by s.o.’s will. <i lang="ceb">Abáhu (báhu) kunsidirasiyun
